definition: skin cast off during molting/exuvia/to pupate/to molt/to slough/to cast off an old skin or shell
lower form of animal life, including insects, insect larvae, worms and similar creatures/CL:條|条[tiao2],隻|只[zhi1]/(fig.) person with a particular undesirable characteristic
to cash/to exchange/to add (liquid)/to blend/one of the Eight Trigrams 八卦[ba1 gua4], symbolizing swamp/☱
skin cast off during molting/exuvium/to pupate/to molt/to slough/to cast off an old skin or shell
(of insects) to undergo metamorphosis/(fig.) to be transformed/to metamorphose/to become degraded
cicada slough/fig. to free oneself/to extricate oneself from
to shed skin/to leave one's mortal envelope/remains (of a priest)

sentences.english: It was free to shed it's cocoon of anger and fear and sadness.
sentences.chinese: 小字眼自由地蜕去了愤怒，恐惧和悲伤的茧。

sentences.english: Serpents cast their skin once a year.
During this single day, they molt twice, mate, and lay eggs in water.
sentences.chinese: 在这一天中它要蜕两次皮，交配，在水中产卵。

sentences.english: The difficult days are the result of the sloughing off of a dense vibration that is tremendously discordant.
sentences.chinese: 难熬的日子是蜕去那些特别不和谐的致密振动的结果。

sentences.english: Wouldn't it be all tight to moult tight here?
How do insects' bodies change after they shed their old covers?
sentences.chinese: 昆虫的躯体在蜕去旧皮之后会发生什么变化？

sentences.english: ConclusionChantui should be regarded as a new officinal part of Bufo bufo gargarizans Cantor.
sentences.chinese: 结论蟾蜕应为药用动物蟾蜍的一个新的药用部位。

definition: levitation (of Daoist immortal)/to become as light as a feather and ascend to heaven/(in Daoism) to become immortal/to die/of winged insects, to emerge from the cocoon in adult form/eclosion
